Post.Post:
So it is my time to farewell the World Cup 2018.
It ended 1 week ago and I still have the feeling that the championship is still going on. Just go to Nikolskaya and you`ll see crowds of tourists, turn on the TV and you`ll see the exciting matches. I believe that this huge event has cheered up the whole nation.
What I will remember the most? First of all I will remember the game England – Tunisia – that was my first experience of watching football at the stadium, attending the world scale event. Though I`m not a big football fan. I`m as they say “Kuzmich”, glory hunter, I root for the winners, know only popular names, remember only the most impressive moments, but still I watch it every European championship and each World Cup.
I will remember Volgograd being center of the world. I saw it previously asleep as any Russia`s provincial town, and I saw it awake. I met in one day journalists from all over the world: the Guardian, the Telegraph, the SkyNews, the Fox, the MatchTV. All in one place, in one pub exactly. I talked to friendly fans from different countries. I saw those enormous efforts and brilliant organization of everything.
I will remember the play of our Russian team. Finally they didn`t disappoint their fans. After they beat Spain I went to Nikolskaya street and felt the joy of the crowd from inside.
I actually felt pride for my country for the way everything was organized and how our team played.
But what I will remember the most is the day when with Eduard Vidostudio we went to Nikolskaya just to talk to people from all over the world and film some interview. It was the 26th of June, the middle of the championship. And we met different people: from USA, Mexico, Columbia, Peru, Argentina, Brazil, Denmark, Serbia, Guatemala, Saudi Arabia. And the conversations were so kind and sincere. Everybody was so opened. We planned to make a short video for youtube, but it appeared to me impossible. I can cut myself, my questions, my phrases, my face, but I can`t cut the words of fans, people who were so nice to us. Eduard did his version earlier, you can watch it here https://youtu.be/Jjt7YbXk8SA with translation (I was a little ill and the voice got tired in the middle of it).
But I thought that it should have been done differently. So I did my own edition in English (with Russian subtitles – they are still coming). By the end it is a whole film about what they liked here, what happened with them, how they managed to get here, how they find Russia, Moscow, other cities, organization, food, prices, people, what we can improve. It was the middle of the championship so it is quite interesting to watch what people forecasted: who would win.
So it is quite long (almost 1 hour), you`d better take a cup of something, relax in your chair and enjoy Farewell to World Cup 2018. Thanks!🙏
https://youtu.be/gllqOSoxlVk

Post.Post:
"EXCLUSIVE: Fil-Italian actor-director Ruben Soriquez owes international success to ‘Dolce Amore’" (Push.com.ph) "
Apat na taon na sa Pilipinas ang Italian actor-director na si Ruben Soriquez. Nakapagdirek na siya noon ng isang indie film titled Of Sinners And Saints na siya rin ang bida at si Polo Ravales pero mas natutukan siya ng spotlight when he played the role of Liza Soberano’s adoptive father sa ABS-CBN series na Dolce Amore.
Ayon kay Ruben, ang goal niya talaga noon kung bakit nagpunta ng Pilipinas ay para magdirek. Mas mura raw kasing gumawa ng pelikula dito kesa sa Italy.
“My first aim is to direct only,” simula niyang kuwento sa PUSH. “But before, I was an actor in Italy, theater actor. And I studied two years in an acting academy before starting to direct.
“But I didn’t really push my acting here. I’m just lucky that I won best actor in Of Sinners And Saints in 2015 World Premieres Film Festival-Philippines (ng FDCP, Film Development Council of the Philippines).
“And then, that year, ABS-CBN was looking for an Italian actor who could act in English, little Tagalog, so they were searching on the Internet if ever there was somebody but they didn’t find anybody.
“When the project manager typed ‘Italian Actor Philippines’ in Google, they found me. But they don’t have my number. Luckily, June Rufino had my number. So she gave my number to ABS-CBN and they called me,” dire-diretso pa niyang kuwento sa PUSH.
Inamin ni Ruben na maraming magagandang bagay ang nagawa sa kanya ng Dolce Amore.
Aniya, “I got the role in an international TV series, I got it because of Dolce Amore. Because the casting director knew me from Dolce Amore,” pagmamalaki niya sabay pakiusap na huwag na muna naming isulat ang pangalan ng Hollywood action star na bida rito dahil bawal pa raw.
Patuloy pa niya, “Dolce Amore is a blessing, really. Kasi Dolce Amore now is being aired abroad, in Malaysia. So I get a lot of following requests from Malaysian fans. Not only Pinoys living in Malaysia but also Malaysian. They love the teleserye.”
Nabibigyan din daw siya ng mga role sa pelikula ng mga naging director niya sa Dolce Amore na sina Mae Cruz at Cathy Garcia-Molina.
“I also got a small role in Can’t Help Falling In Love, in Unexpectedly Yours. Pero minsan, wala talagang role na bagay sa akin,” sabi ulit ni Ruben.
Samantala, hindi itinanggi ni Ruben na nami-miss niyang katrabaho ang LizQuen.
“I’m not part of their new teleserye, yung Bagani. Pero, yeah, nami-miss ko sila makatrabaho ulit, yung LizQuen. Sana, sana next year magkaroon ulit ng project with them. Pero next year mayroon akong mga project sa Italy, so I hope they don’t call me when I’m busy sa Italy,” natatawa niyang pahayag.
“Actually I have a… I’m attached to a firm in the US as a director, but still it’s in a developing stage. So I have to go to US also as a director,” susog niya.
Ibinalita rin ng Fil-Italian director na meron siyang bagong pelikula.
“Meron akong isang bagong movie, The Spider’s Men. Meaning the men of spiders. Kasama ko sa movie sina Richard Quan, Lee O’Brian, Jeffrey Tam the magician, Rob Sy. It’s a black comedy na ako rin ang nagdirek, nag-produce at sumulat.
“Ang tema is I will reconnect with my half-Pinoy brother. Pero may sakit siya, autistic siya (Richard). Comedy na may drama rin and there’s thriller, because some guys, they try to take advantage of me and my brother. It will be bloody. Actually, parang Quentin Tarantino style,” paliwanag niya sa concept ng movie.
Bukod dito ay bida rin siya sa pelikulang The Lease kasama si Garie Concepcion na tungkol naman sa paranormal thriller.
" Continue: http://push.abs-cbn.com/…/exclusive-fil-italian-actor-direc…

Mudras Calling (non-spoiler review)
Before my review of MUDRAS CALLING, I would like to explain about my relation between me and Myanmar Films. It’s been a pretty long time that I don’t enjoy Myanmar films. I watched some but just couldn’t enjoy. I have to admit that I expected some to be something different with typical films since they said that is not like the other typical film. You will see something special blah blah and I believed. But one after another, it keeps coming till I say goodbye forever to Myanmar film.
“Deception” was a famous one. I could enjoy a bit but not at all (I don’t compare " Deception " with other typical films. IF SO, D IS Already ON WHOLE NEW LEVEL ) Now KYI Couple who is the creator of “ Deception “ introduces us a Film, MUDRAS CALLING. They created MUDRAS CALLING on 2014 and won several awards. But it couldn’t be on theater until today. So it’s been a 4 years already.
The film is about Jaden who was raised in US returns to Myanmar (his native) for his thesis on Myanmar music. He met Hnin who is graduated with art and currently running a tour agency. So Nu (Hnin’s friend) and Hnin starts the tour with Jaden in order to help him for Thesis. During the tour, something they would never imagined are happened, and they found out about Jaden’s past.
There are some weak points I found. Supporting character Nu lost her role. I have no idea why she is in the film. According to Myanmar society, two opposite sexes travel overnight is kinda unacceptable and that’s the reason why Nu is with them. Even though, she has been disappeared almost all the time but Jaden checked his camera, and we could see the pictures of Nu and Hnin together. But not in the film. And on the bus (overnight) Jaden and Hnin are together and Nu is behind them. That’s crazy. I think that is the worst mistake KYI ever made. And one more thing is in Inle. Jaden sits at the most behind of everyone. Others will think that’s not a problem but for me, as a tour guide, I found that is weird. Jaden is guest anyway. And he even has the camera. He should be at the front of the boat.
The thing that impressed me much is background music I may be wrong but as far as I know, this is the first time we can see film with such kind of background music. Sometimes it is pretty loud. But it is not a big deal. Some may say Hnin and Nu’s language is not good enough and Hnin focuses on her dialogue too much that could make her acting looks weird. But I think it should be. Their characters cannot speak English as natives since they are not raised in US. The view of Myanmar in the film is beautiful. But KYI didn’t force her audiences to think Myanmar is awesome. Myanmar is pretty. Honest blah blah. She just show what Jaden see and that makes us more interesting, and we could still feel like we are watching film. Not a bird eye view of Myanmar.
Actings are not perfect. But still better than other typical actors. Even me as a drama blind, the family reunion scene makes me feel warm. They don’t exaggerate. Only their eyes talk since there’s a language difference. And it occurs to me that some supporting characters from typical films also have such a good acting skill and they just didn’t have a chance to show. I saw a man from typical film. I don’t even know his name. He plays an important role but only for a couple minute, and he didn’t talk a lot. He played all by his eyes. It is completely different with him, we saw in earlier typical film. I wish KYI could make the boat departing scene little longer, that would be heart touching.
And there are some romantic scenes but still in reality. There is an odd sounding word about typical film. It is "watch a film as a film". I can't agree. Unless the film is fiction like Harry Potter, it should not be so different with reality.
I’ve sick on forced acting of typical film. But in this MUDRAS CALLING, I could see what is called acting. It was so simple and romantic enough without roses, wine and of course weird background music.
As a conclusion, MUDRAS CALLING is not a perfect one. And also you won’t like if you are a huge fan of extreme emotional acting and super mega ultra great great words those are too great to exist in real world. Please don’t watch this otherwise you are just wasting your time.
If you love art, true creation and acting with passion, please enjoy. I highly recommend. If you ask my rating on MUDRAS CALLING., I will definitely say 9/10. I believe if they could make it as soon as it finished in 2014 that would have been better.
I believe KYI Couple will be able to revolt the influences of earlier typical film and they let us show the world what Myanmar film is. It doesn’t mean MUDRAS is good enough to win Oscar. But it is more than enough to show your foreign friends who would like to know about Myanmar film . At least it won’t bring a shame. I expect more and more not only from KYI Couple also from the others. Honestly, I don’t want to see good films only from KYI Couple. Hope others will also try to fix themselves instead of bashing.
Thank you so much KYI Couple for bringing such a quality one.
#Teno
PS. Comments with broken English are also welcomed. No discrimination s are allowed under my post.

JONAS KAUFMANN AT ZDF WITH ITALIAN REPERTOIRE
ENGLISH TRANSLATION OF THE ARTICLE AND RADIO INTERVIEW
English Article: "Translation by Laura Fontana -
ESSEN opera star Jonas Kaufmann is facing a high point of his carrer. ZDF shows his concert. He also enjoys the moment off stage.
The opera star is looking forward to his evening also because ZDF broadcasts Jonas Kaufmann's concert for a large audience on the Sunday after the next Sunday (July 15th, 10 pm), which the tenor is giving two days earlier in Berlin's Waldbühne.
The 48-year-old enjoys these days downright, where he stands on stage in the evening and can do what he wants during the day. When the weather is good, he can sail and does not need to worry about being called constantly. Nobody wanted to bother an artist shortly before the performance: "Nobody dares to talk to me about schedule or anything like that."
With the ZDF concert he wants to "refresh the old enthusiasm for Italy with the audience living on north of the Alps". He sings, accompanied by an orchestra, Italian opera hits, including Verismo arie by Mascagni and Leoncavallo. It is a program of great culture that the former mathematics student tries to make palatable to the television audience.
Rebirth of the opera singer Enrico Caruso (1873-1921)
It is a heartfelt concern for Kaufmann, for whom Italy is a longing country. He grew up with this music, he calls his parents Italian. They laid the foundation for Kaufmann's world career. It has long been more than just a tenor: Many fans consider him a reincarnation of Enrico Caruso, the world-famous opera singer from Naples.
The notoriety of Kaufmann, who has sung in Milan, Paris, Brussels and Vienna, extends far beyond the classical world. At the final of the Champions League 2013, for example, he was on the side of pop violinist David Garrett a guest in front of tens of thousands football fans. He finds his Italian concert in Berlin something special. "I like it when you feel an audience. I also do not know excactly what you feel but you can tell if people are there, if they drift off, if they need to do something, use a gimmick to get them back."
Two concerts with colourful opera program in Spain
As casually as the Munich native comes across in conversation with his elegant appearance and his gentle Bavarian language coloration, the tenor knows the dark side of the classical world. Most recently, he caused a sensation with an interview in which he reported how he had been sexually harassed at the beginning of his career when a manager offered him a concert if he went with him in the sauna. In addition, Kaufmann is constantly under pressure: from Berlin he travels to the Schleswig-Holstein Music Festival.
Shortly thereafter, he sings Siegmund in Wagner's "Valkyrie" in Munich, then two concerts with a colourful opera program in Spain, then back to Munich for the conclusion of the opera festival. All this before the actual Summer break, which often means festival time for singers and musicians and therefore lot of work. Is this work healthy?
The father of three children is compensated by his family
Kaufmann says he is able to relax during working hours, and justifies this with his Italian socialization. "It is part of the Dolce Vita that one understands the art of enjoying the moment. In this way you can enjoy ten minutes of free time. I do not need time to get down."
A compensation for the father of three children is staying with his family. Or he likes to relax on his boat. Sometimes he also cleans the kitchen late at night to distract himself. "You have to be there unconditionally," says Kaufmann, "then you just get a little less sleep."
Return to the Homeland
Because he does not want to give it all up, he is glad to have finally arrived. Seven years ago he moved back to his hometown in Munich, he made the city his retreat. Meanwhile, he works at the Bayerische Staatsoper, where he is on stage with "Parsifal". He feels well in Munich, where he does not have to "hide in the movies in the evening to forget that sometimes you are often alone in this job."
In London or New York, where the sought-after Wagner tenor leads many journeys, he sometimes feels lonely. These cities, he says, remained strangers to him. Not everything is perfect in Bavaria. But there he has other, lighter problems: "In Munich, I have to coordinate the many contacts and sometimes go with people to drink the beer that I have long promised them."
________________________________________________________________
English Summary Radio Interview: "Translation by Laura Fontana - Summary ARD / rbb interview 2018-07-06 Vis á vis
Presenter asks about the difference between Opera house and Waldbühne: wheather Jonas Kaufmann is more relaxed at Open Air.
JK: "Although the event is different, even at such concerts the concentration must be the same, maybe a bit more in front of 20 000 persons. In 19th century Opera was a sort of Pop Music, similar to the music in 20 th century. Both parts must be presentent carefully, weather and atmosphere help. Connection to an audience at a place like Waldbühne is relaxed and free."
Presenter mentiones the behaviour at Open Air, eating and drinking and moving around.
Asks about the very big repertory and using often his voice.
JK: "Preparation is always the same. Careful use of the voice is important, also right timing and mix."
Presenter: "Difficult to be on the top?"
JK: "Woderful to be successful, but also a burden to fulfill the expectations of audience and myself. To keep the level is hard work."
Presenter: "What`s about the High C?"
JK: "The dark coloured voice has an ordinary depth and also still the high, until E, what means not only C. This tone is magical; more psychologically than physically. H is much easier, although only a half tone lower and less stressful. Identification with the role avoids permanent thinking on a coming C."
Presenter: "What can help to take C more easy? Can gestures help?"
JK: "Only psycologigally gestures or movement can support; the vocal cords must do it too. Singing must be as easy as speaking."
Presenter: "How do you manage voice problems? You stated that you are well again after your stop."
JK: "Positive eperiences are important: on the other hand it is also important to stop in time if there is a problem with the voice, to avoid negative ones. Cancellations are always difficult. Start with Lohengrin was a bit more stressful, but it worked."
Presenter: "What are the dreams and plans?"
JK: "Tristan, Tote Stadt, some Italian roles, Palestrina, perhaps the both Siegfrieds, and two or three more. Also a lot of concert programms."

ON THIS DAY
1967, The Beatles held a press conference at University College in Bangor, North Wales with Maharishi Mahesh Yogi. The Beatles announced that they had become disciples of the guru and that they renounced the use of drugs. The four had become members of the Maharishi's 'Spiritual Regeneration Movement', which obligated them to donate one week's earnings each month to the organization.
1970, Joan Baez, Joni Mitchell, Jimi Hendrix, (his last ever UK appearance), Donovan, Jethro Tull, Miles Davis, Arrival, Cactus, Family, Taste, Mungo Jerry, ELP, The Doors, The Who, Spirit, The Moody Blues, Chicago, Procol Harum, Sly and the Family Stone and Free all appeared over three days at the third Isle Of Wight Festival. Weekend tickets, £3.
1973, 10cc made their live debut at the Palace Lido Isle of Man at the start of an UK tour. Comprising of Graham Gouldman, Eric Stewart, Kevin Godley and Lol Creme, who had written and recorded together for some three years before assuming the 10cc name.
1987, Sonny Bono, who once said that he never voted until he was 53, announced that he was running for mayor of Palm Springs, California. He won the election in 1988 and went on to win a seat in Congress in 1996.
1993, A double sided acetate of The Beatles performing live at The Cavern Club in Liverpool sold for £16,500 at Christies, London, a world record price for a recording.
1994, Scottish singer Frankie Miller suffered a massive brain haemorrhage in New York, while writing material for a new band he and Joe Walsh had formed. Miller spent five months in a coma. He then entered rehabilitation, re-learning how to walk and talk.
1995, Blur scored their first UK No.1 single with 'Country House' and won a media battle with Oasis for the No.1 position. Both acts released their new singles on the same day, 'Country House' topped the chart, selling 270,000 copies, compared to 'Roll with It' which sold 220,000, seeing Oasis entering the chart at No.2.
1995, Seal went to No.1 on the US singles chart with 'Kiss From A Rose', taken from the film 'Batman Forever' a No.4 hit in the UK.
2003, Rolling Stone Magazine named Jimi Hendrix as the greatest guitarist in Rock history. Eric Clapton, Jimmy Page, Keith Richards, Chuck Berry Stevie Ray Vaughan and Ry Cooder also made the top 10 list.
2004, Singer Laura Branigan died of a brain aneurysm. She had had a 1982 US No.2 & UK No.6 single with ‘Gloria’ and a 1984 US No.4 & UK No.5 with ‘Self Control’. She had also played Janis Joplin in the US musical Love, Janis.
2005, A post office near the Los Angeles studio where Ray Charles recorded much of his music was renamed after the R&B legend. A federal bill was signed by US President George Bush to rename the post office. Charles, died in June 2004 at the age of 74, suffering from acute liver disease.
2007, Police who raided the home of US rap star DMX, found 12 neglected pit bull terrier dogs and a number of guns. The bodies of three more dogs had been buried. No arrests were made and DMX told police he had not been at the property in Arizona for at least two months. The rapper who had launched his own range of dog clothing, including caps, scarves and raincoats for canines also featured on the cover of his latest album, Year of the Dog... Again, with a pit bull straining at the leash.
2007, After two years, The Rolling Stones played the final show on their A Bigger Bang World Tour at the O2 Arena in London, England. The longest and biggest tour of their career, it became the highest grossing in rock history ($560 million).
2014, Kate Bush made her stage comeback at London's Hammersmith Apollo to an ecstatic response from fans at her first live concert for 35 years. Bush received a standing ovation as she closed the show with 'Cloudbusting', from her 1985 hit album The Hounds of Love. The 22 shows had completely sold out in less than fifteen minutes, after tickets were released in March of this year.
BORN ON THIS DAY
1938, English drummer Jet Black (Brian John Duffy), one of the founding members of The Stranglers, and who is now one of the oldest working rock drummers. They had major mainstream success with their 1982 single 'Golden Brown'. Before forming The Stranglers, Black was a successful businessman up until the mid-1970s, owning a fleet of ice cream vans.
1941, Chris Curtis, drums, The Searchers, (1964 UK No.1 single 'Needles And Pins'1964 US No.3 single 'Love Potion Number Nine'). Died on 28th Feb 2005 at the age of 63 after a long illness.
1948, Valerie Simpson, from husband-and-wife songwriting-production team Ashford and Simpson, who had the 1985 UK No. 3 single 'Solid'. They wrote hits such as: 'Ain't No Mountain High Enough', 'You're All I Need To Get By', 'Ain't Nothing Like the Real Thing', and 'Reach Out and Touch (Somebody's Hand)'.
1954, Michael Chetwood, Keyboards, T'Pau, who had the 1987 UK No.1 single 'China In Your Hand' and the 1987 US & UK No.4 single 'Heart And Soul', (which was initially a flop in the UK). T'Pau took their name from a Vulcan elder of the same name in the sci-fi series Star Trek.
1957, John O'Neill, The Undertones (1980 UK No.9 single 'My Perfect Cousin').
1966, Dan Vickrey, guitarist, from American rock band Counting Crows, who had the 1994 UK hit single 'Mr Jones', and the 1996 US No.1 album Recovering The Satellites. They received a 2004 Academy Award nomination for their song 'Accidentally in Love', which was included in the film Shrek 2.
1966, Shirley Manson, vocals, Garbage, (1996 UK No. 4 single 'Stupid Girl').
1969, Adrian Young, drummer, No Doubt, (1997 UK No.1 single 'Don't Speak', 1997 No.1 US album 'Tragic Kingdom').

🔺Relate of JKS Doota Duty Free Fan Meeting 🔺
~ Our Memories ~ in Seoul 2018
cr. English trans twitter@yachan19870804
In the mini concert segment JKS sang :
Parade
For you
I miss you (I wanna see you)
Graduation trip,
Tomorrow
Voyage
Eels kept on chanting “JKS! JKS!” for encore & JKS looked likely to sing more. But when JKS did this gesture, MC appeared on the stage and the show finished.
Talk about the torch relay :
🎤 : Are you ready for the torch relay?
👑 : l feel like acting goofy around with eels but since representing my country I’ll carry the torch seriously.
Then, JKS showed eels how to run using microphone.
🎥 Talk about his new Drama :
JKS’ new drama “Switch - Change the world” seems to be a manly one, without a love story.
Actually JKS received the script and he decided to appear in the new drama last year when he had the hall tour. Staff asked him many times not to tell eels about it because he has a loose tongue.
JKS will start filming the drama next month. He’s been on a diet for 3 weeks with no carbohydrates. Without carb he gets sleepy he said.
JKS has been on a diet for 3 weeks since he decided to appear in the new drama. He ate only two bananas today. When he exited the stage, he said, “I’m hungry.”
As JKS’ new drama will start to air on March 14. He will begin shooting next month, so he said probably he cannot go to Berlin International Film Festival.
🎬 Talk about his new Movie :
JKS has not seen his movie “Human, Space, Time and Human” yet. Actors and actresses appearing in Kim Ki Duk’s films always buy tickets for themselves and watch their movies in movie theaters first after they are released.
🎥 Talk about his new Drama :
In the new drama JKS will play a double role. Prosecutor is a really serious person, a square.
The other is a con artist.
Being asked which is more like him, JKS answered “Con artist!” right away.
Being asked about the new drama, JKS answered “Challenging new things is important. It is not a love story which you love, but it’s about man’s world.”
Eels were very relieved to hear that. LOL
JKS had a haircut not only for his drama. He wanted to look mature. He received the script at the end of last year and he started thinking he would be different from what he was. He wanted to get it cut really short, but GSM & YD said no, so he secretly got it cut more.
▪️In the quiz segment :
JKS confessed he drank alcohol first when he was in the 1st year of junior high school. He drank 3 bottles of beer.
👀 Watch out! AP is watching you!
JKS can watch footage of CCTV at Pleno on his cell phone, so he sees what eels are doing. He can even see them fixing their makeup. ㅋㅋㅋㅋ
The tour guide said 956 eels attended the fan meeting today. 👍🏼

🎤 : คุณพร้อมกับการวิ่งคบเพลิงหรือยัง?
👑 : ผมอาจจะทำตัวบ้าๆบอๆกับปลาไหลของผม แต่เนื่องจากนี่เป็นงานในฐานะตัวแทนของประเทศ ผมก็เลยต้องจริงจังกับมันนะครับ
ว่าแล้วจางกึนซ็อกก็โชว์การวิ่งให้ปลาไหลดูโดยใช้ไมโครโฟนแทนคบเพลิง
🎥 พูดถึงเรื่องละครใหม่ (1)
อย่างที่ทราบกันว่าละครเรื่องใหม่ของชายจางมีชื่อว่า Switch - Change the World และดูเหมือนว่าเรื่องนี้จะออกแนวแบบแมนๆ ไม่มีบทรักโรแมนติกนะคะ
อันที่จริงแล้วชายจางได้รับสคริปท์ของเรื่องนี้และก็ตัดสินใจจะรับบทนี้ตั้งแต่ปลายปีที่แล้ว และในคอนเสิร์ต พวกสต๊าฟต้องคอยย้ำกับเขาตลอดว่าอย่าพูดเรื่องนี้ให้ปลาไหลฟัง เพราะอย่างที่รู้กันว่าชายจางมักจะเผลอหลุดพูดออกมาตลอด
ละครเรื่องใหม่นี้จะเริ่มถ่ายทำในเดือนหน้า จางกึนซ็อกเริ่มไดเอทแบบไม่กินพวกคาร์โบไฮเดรตมาได้ 3 อาทิตย์แล้ว โดยเขาบอกว่าถ้าไม่มีจำพวกแป้งจะง่วงมากๆ
ตั้งแต่ตัดสินใจรับเล่นละครเรื่องใหม่ จางกึนซ็อกไดเอทมา 3 อาทิตย์แล้ว และวันนี้เขาได้กินแค่กล้วย 2 ลูก พอเขาปรากฎตัวบนเวทีเขาพูดว่า “ผมหิวจังเลย”
เนื่องจากละครจะออกอากาศในวันที่ 14 มีนาคม และต้องถ่ายทำละครในเดือนหน้า ชายจางเลยบอกว่าเขาอาจจะไม่ได้ไปร่วมงานเทศกาลภาพยนตร์นานาชาติที่เบอร์ลิน
🎬 พูดถึงผลงานภาพยนตร์เรื่องใหม่ :
จางกึนซ็อกบอกว่าเขายังไม่ได้ดูหนังเรื่อง “Human, Space, Time and Human” ที่เขาแสดงเลย โดยนักแสดงทุกคนที่เล่นหนังของคิมคิด๊กฟิลม์จะซื้อตั๋วกันเองและไปดูหนังที่พวกเขาแสดงกันในวันแรกที่ออกฉายในโรงภาพยนตร์
🎥 พูดถึงเรื่องละครใหม่ (2)
ในละครเรื่องใหม่นี้ จางกึนซ็อกจะเล่นเป็น 2 บทบาท โดยจะแสดงบทเป็นพนักงานอัยการที่เป็นคนซีเรียสและเถรตรง ส่วนอีกบทแสดงเป็นนักต้มตุ๋น
พอถูกถามว่า บทไหนที่คล้ายตัวตนของเขา จางกึนซ็อกรีบตอบทันทีว่า “นักต้มตุ๋น”
พิธีกรถามเกี่ยวกับละครใหม่ว่าเป็นอย่างไร จางกึนซ็อกตอบว่า “การท้าทายสิ่งใหม่ๆเป็นเรื่องสำคัญ มันไม่ใช่เรื่องเกี่ยวกับความรัก ในแบบที่พวกคุณชอบ แต่มันเป็นเรื่องของโลกมนุษย์”
กับคำตอบนี้ ดูเหมือนว่าปลาไหลจะโล่งใจกันมากกว่านะ ฮ่าๆๆ
จางกึนซ็อกเผยว่า ที่เขาตัดผมสั้นไม่ใช่เป็นเพราะเกี่ยวกับเรื่องละครอย่างเดียว แต่เขาอยากจะให้ตัวเองดูเป็นผู้ใหญ่ เขาได้สคริปท์ละครมาเมื่อปลายปีที่แล้ว เขาเลยเริ่มคิดว่าเขาจะทำยังไงให้ตัวเองดูแตกต่างจากที่เคยเป็น เขาเลยไปตัดผมและจริงๆเขาอยากจะตัดให้สั้นๆไปเลย แต่ป๋ากอนกับยองดึก(ผจก.ส่วนตัว)บอกว่าห้ามเอาไว้ เขาก็เลยแอบไปตัดผมให้สั้นกว่าเดิมอีกนิดหน่อย
▪️ในช่วงตอบคำถาม :
จางกึนซ็อกสารภาพว่าเขาดื่มแอลกอฮอล์ครั้งแรก ตอนที่อยู่ไฮสกูลปี 1 โดยตอนนั้นเขาดื่มเบียร์ไปทั้งหมด 3 ขวด
👀 ระวังนะจ๊ะ! ชายจางกำลังมองคุณอยู่!
จางกึนซ็อกบอกว่า เขาสามารถดูภาพจากกล้อง CCTV ในร้าน Cafe PLENO ได้จากมือถือของเขา เขาเห็นทุกอย่างที่ปลาไหลทำ แม้กระทั่งตอนที่ปลาไหลเติมแป้งแต่งหน้าก็เห็นนะจ๊ะ คิคิคิ ㅋㅋㅋㅋ
ไกด์ทัวร์บอกว่า มีปลาไหลเข้าร่วมงานมีตติ้งวันนี้ทั้งหมด 956 คน 👍🏼

ON THIS DAY
1962, John Lennon married Cynthia Powell at Liverpool's Mount Pleasant register office. He then played a gig that night with The Beatles at Liverpool's Riverpark Ballroom.
1963, The Rolling Stones appeared on UK TV show Ready, Steady, Go! for the first time, performing their debut single 'Come On.' The group made a total of 20 appearances on the show between 1963 and 1966.
1965, Security guards at a Manchester TV studio hosed down 200 Rolling Stones fans after they broke down barriers while waiting for the band to arrive for a performance.
1967, Enjoying a wild birthday party Keith Moon drummer with The Who drove his Lincoln car into a Holiday Inn swimming pool. As the party had become out of control, the police were called to put an end to the festivities. Moon, ever keen to avoid the boys in blue snuck outside and got into a Lincoln Continental Limousine and attempted to make a getaway. Unfortunately, in his inebriated state he released the handbrake, and began rolling towards the pool. Moon simply sat back and waited, as the car crashed through the fence around the pool and into the water.
1969, Johnny Cash started a four-week run at No.1 on the US album chart with 'Johnny Cash At San Quentin'. The album was a recording of a live concert given to the inmates of San Quentin State Prison and was the follow-up to Cash's previous live album, the critically acclaimed and commercially successful At Folsom Prison.
1969, The Rolling Stones started a four week run at No.1 on the US singles chart with 'Honky Tonk Women' the group's fifth US No.1. The song written by Mick Jagger and Keith Richards was inspired by Brazilian gauchos at the ranch where Jagger and Richards were staying in Matao, Sao Paulo.
1970, Lou Reed and the Velvet Underground performed together for the last time at the New York Club 'Max's Kansas City'. Reed worked as a typist for his father for the next two years, at $40 per week.
1980, David Bowie was at No.1 on the UK singles chart with 'Ashes To Ashes' his second UK No.1. Taken from the Scary Monsters (and Super Creeps) album, the song continued the story of Major Tom from Bowie's 'Space Oddity'. The video for 'Ashes to Ashes' was one of the most iconic of the 1980s and costing £250,000, it was at the time the most expensive music video ever made.
1986, Sigue Sigue Sputnik came up with an idea to sell advertising space between the tracks on their forthcoming new album. It was a non-starter.
2003, Lee Ryan of boy band Blue was banned from driving for 18 months after admitting drink-driving. Ryan was also ordered to pay a £2250 fine at Tower Bridge magistrate's court London.
2005, Les McKeown the lead singer of the Bay City Rollers appeared in court charged with drugs offences. McKeown, aged 49, was accused of conspiring with four other people, including the band's drummer Pat McGlynn, to supply cocaine. He was arrested in Dalston, east London, in June as part of a major police operation.
BORN ON THIS DAY
1946, English drummer Keith Moon, The Who. With The Who he scored the 1965 UK No.2 single 'My Generation' plus over 20 other Top 40 hits, 1967 US No.9 single 'I Can See For Miles' and rock opera albums 'Tommy' & 'Quadrophenia'. Moon was voted the second-greatest drummer in history by a Rolling Stone readers' poll. Moon died on 7th September 1978 after taking 32 clomethiazole tablets.
1949, Rick Springfield, US singer, songwriter, (1981 US No.1 & UK No.43 single 'Jessie's Girl').
1951, Jimi Jamison, Survivor, (1982 US & UK No.1 single 'Eye Of The Tiger') and as the voice and co-writer of the theme song for Baywatch. Jamison died at the age of 63 on August 31, 2014 in Memphis, Tennessee. from a heart attack.
1953, Bobby G, singer with British pop group Bucks Fizz who had the UK hits 'Making Your Mind Up' (1981), 'The Land of Make Believe' (1981) and 'My Camera Never Lies' (1982) and became one of the top-selling groups of the 1980s.
1954, Mark Avsec, keyboardist, songwriter, Donnie Iris & the Cruisers, Wild Cherry, (1976 US No.1 & UK No.7 single 'Play That Funky Music').
1959, Edwyn Collins, singer, songwriter, producer, Orange Juice, (1983 UK No.8 single 'Rip It Up'), solo, (1995 UK No.4 single 'A Girl Like You').
1961, Dean DeLeo, guitarist with Stone Temple Pilots, Talk Show and Army of Anyone. His younger brother, bass guitarist Robert DeLeo, was also a member of the band.
1962, English musician and singer-songwriter Shaun Ryder, best known as the lead singer of the Happy Mondays and Black Grape. He was the runner-up of the tenth series of I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! Ryder's struggle with drugs led to the break-up of Happy Mondays in 1992. The film 24 Hour Party People featured the (semi-fictional) story of Shaun Ryder's youth and the life of Happy Mondays whilst signed with Factory Records in the late '80s and early '90s.
1967, Cedella Marley, Ziggy Marley & The Melody Makers, (1988 UK No.22 single 'Tomorrow People').
1978, Julian Casablancas, guitarist, singer, songwriter from American rock band The Strokes who had the 2001 UK No.14 single 'Last Nite' and the 2001 UK No.2 album Is This It.
1986, SkyBluone (Skyler Austen Gordy), one half of LMFAO who had the 2011 world wide hits 'Party Rock Anthem' and 'Sexy And I Know It'.

Hello everyone! My name is TIEN, I'm 21 years old. I was born in Tien Giang province and now I am living at Dormitory B of Vietnam National University Ho Chi Minh City. I am a third-years student at University of Information Technology and my major is Networking and Telecommunication. I am a big fan of One Piece and detective Conan. My friends said that I am a friendly and humourous person, it is easy to talk to me but very hard to close. I like playing video games, listening to music and watching movie. I like taking photo too, if you want to have beautiful photos to upload on facebook, instagram,... contact me and it will free for ORO girl members 😜😜
Joining this community, I hope to get a chance to improve my English skill and get more friend.
Thank you for reading!!

" *Where Ignorance is Bliss...*"
*Randoulph L. A. Wilson*
The quest for academic depth continues to dwindle among the current young generation. The clamour for mere certificates, diplomas and degrees has surpassed the passion for knowledge acquisition. As such it is now common to see people with decorated academic certificates yet cannot measure up to what is on those documents.
I applaud the government for launching the free education drive. But I have the feeling that things will not change for the better if younger folks fail to do the needful. The pursuit for academic excellence and the ability to articulate and communicate well is not one that must be limited to the four corners of the classroom. How many of our graduates and undergraduates are making it a habit to keep glued to local and international news, read newspapers, magazines and books? My grandma of blessed memory, even at age 89 years, was a fan of newspapers, though not being a graduate. The willingness and genuineness to learn is what is our challenge. How many of these graduates have in their possession dictionaries, Brighter Grammar series and basic Mathematics text? Our shelves, tables and racks are filled with all other things, but not with a single book or dictionary. We spend thousands of leones in purchasing all the TV series, Naija Movies and SL Music. But not a dime a week on a Newspaper.
The speaking of our lingua franca (Krio) has become rampant even in English Language classes in our schools and universities. It is now a mockery to those who dare to communicate in English. You will be considered strange and pretentious. This has given rise to horrible pronunciation, arid vocabulary and poor use of tenses. You attempt to correct people, even in private and in the most subtle and humble fashion, they still will take offence and raise up a defence. You will hear words like; " *Papa/Mama na u sabi. English nor to we language go England*." Very true, English is not our first language, but every educated Sierra Leonean is expected to write and speak it with a certain degree of proficiency. That besides, those very people who bash at others for being too " *bookish/English*" are the same people who cannot speak well their local language. Even Krio is quite another problem for people to speak with astuteness, talk less of English. They are neither here nor there. They aught to know that learning must not be confined just to the classroom. Let us do less with the fashion, cosmetics and football gossips/entertainment and do more in developing our intellect and skills.
Let me end with one of my favourite quotes by John Dryden: " *Errors, like straws, upon the surface flow; He who would search for pearls must dive below*."

First of all I would love to wish my beloved Annayya, "Young Dynamic, daring and dashing, Supreme hero, and Mega Star" Chiranjeevi, I wish you many many more happy returns returns of the day.
I am working as an English lecturer, but you are my inspiration (Master film) and path. I learnt all from you.
Like, how to walk, How to talk, How to do in shirt, which kind of dress wear, How to behave with others, how to do dance, etc.
"Chiranjeevi is the symbol of Hardwork".
I am really proud to say I am a fan of Supreme hero.
Love from yours,
Kolimigundla Raja.

မၾကိဳက္တဲ့အစားအစာ- ခ်ိဳလြန္း ငန္လြန္း ခ်ဥ္လြန္းတာေတြ ျပီးေတာ့ငါးကိုေျကာက္ေတာ့ငါးလံုးဝမစားဘူး
အိပ္တာနဲ႔စားတာဘာကိုပိုသေဘာက်လဲ- အိပ္တာ
အိမ္ကဆူရင္ဘာလုပ္တတ္လဲ- ဘာမွမစားေတာ့ဘူး
ဘယ္လိုဇာတ္လမ္းေတြအၾကည့္မ်ားလဲ- ဟာသ
ေခ်တယ္လို့ေျပာေနက်တယ္တကယ္ေခ်မွာလား- 😂
Fansေတြကိုေျပာခ်င္တာေလး - က်ြန္ေတာ္ကခင္ဗ်ားတို့နဲ႔ပတ္သတ္ရင္ေလာဘျကီးတယ္ေနာ္ က်ြန္ေတာ္ကလြဲရင္ဘယ္သူ့ကိုမွမခ်စ္ရဘူး 😏
ကိုကိုျမဴခိုးကိုေကာဘာေျပာခ်င္လဲ 😛 - သားမသိဘူး 😂
(မင္မင္မွာပိုခ်စ္တာေပါ့ဒီအေသးေလးကို😍)
